docs.snippet: The world’s top sports court reduced Sharapova’s two-year suspension for taking meldonium, a heart medication that was banned this year....
docs.lead_paragraph: The world’s top sports court reduced Sharapova’s two-year suspension for taking meldonium, a heart medication that was banned this year.
docs.abstract: Court of Arbitration for Sport reduces tennis player Maria Sharapova's doping suspension from two years to 15 months; corporate sponsors move tentatively to repair their relationships with Sharapova, who has consistently claimed she took banned substance, meldonium, for health reasons without realizing it had been placed on prohibited list.

headline.main: With Court Ruling, Maria Sharapova Can Return to Tennis in 2017
headline.print_headline: Sharapova Suspension Is Cut by Nine Months

docs.snippet: The athlete, her handlers and tennis officials all bear some blame for the doping suspension of one of the sport’s biggest stars....
docs.lead_paragraph: The athlete, her handlers and tennis officials all bear some blame for the doping suspension of one of the sport’s biggest stars.
docs.abstract: Christopher Clarey On Tennis column argues reduction of Maria Sharapova's doping suspension by Court of Arbitration for Sport underscores general lack of rigor in International Tennis Federation's effort to shore up confidence in sport's credibility.

headline.main: Sharapova’s Case Shows How Unforced Errors Hurt Cleanup Efforts
headline.print_headline: Unforced Errors Keep Hurting Cleanup Efforts
